New Records: Guirassy, born in France to Guinean parents, scored the first hat-trick in 2025 qualifying.
Key Match Events: Azzedine Ounahi netted twice and Abde Ezzalzouli, Achraf Hakimi and Soufiane Rahimi each scored once as Morocco led 4-0 by half-time.
Serhou Guirassy scored a hat-trick for Morocco, making him the joint leading scorer with Amine Gouiri, Mahmoud 'Trezeguet' Hassan and Jean-Philippe Krasso.
Post-Match Reflections: Guirassy's hat-trick was a standout performance, with the forward outpacing defenders and firing close-range shots into the right corner of the net.
It was a predictable outcome as 114 places separate top-ranked African team Morocco from the Central African Republic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Morocco equalled the biggest winning margin in 2025 qualifying after South Africa set the benchmark with a five-goal drubbing of Congo Brazzaville.
Guinea netted four times within 48 minutes, with Seydouba Cisse setting up the second goal for Guirassy.
Others: DR Congo tops the table with nine points, and shares perfect records halfway through qualifying with Algeria, Angola, Egypt, Ivory Coast and Morocco.
Tanzania have four points and Guinea three, and their November meeting will probably decide who finishes runners-up and accompanies likely table-toppers DR Congo to Morocco.
